itemDescription: British field hockey player and writer

wikipedia_page.main: Marjorie Anne Pollard  (3 August 1899 – 21 March 1982) was an English field hockey and cricket player, film maker and writer. She was the first woman to commentate on sport for the BBC.

link_mentions.page: England women's national field hockey team
response: Marjorie Pollard played hockey nearly every year for England from 1921 to 1937.

link_mentions.page: Peterborough County Grammar School for Girls
response: * Marjorie Pollard OBE, an English field hockey player, and writer; the first woman to commentate on sport for the BBC.

Marjorie Pollard of the Women's Cricket Association, an anti-commercial and pro-amateur organisation, wrote in the 1934 that the Cricketers "‘savoured of exploitation, and was not a genuine effort to provide cricket as a summer game."
